verses.plain: When thou wilt do good know to whom thou doest it; so shalt thou be thanked for thy benefits.

tokens.t: When thou wilt do good know to whom thou doest it; so shalt thou be thanked for thy benefits.

verses.plain: Do good to the godly man, and thou shalt find a recompence; and if not from him, yet from the most High.

tokens.t: Do good to the godly man, and thou shalt find a recompence; and if not from him, yet from the most High.

verses.plain: There can no good come to him that is always occupied in evil, nor to him that giveth no alms.

tokens.t: There can no good come to him that is always occupied in evil, nor to him that giveth no alms.

verses.plain: Give to the godly man, and help not a sinner.

tokens.t: Give to the godly man, and help not a sinner.

verses.plain: Do well unto him that is lowly, but give not to the ungodly: hold back thy bread, and give it not unto him, lest he overmaster thee thereby: for else thou shalt receive twice as much evil for all the good thou shalt have done unto him.

tokens.t: Do well unto him that is lowly, but give not to the ungodly: hold back thy bread, and give it not unto him, lest he overmaster thee thereby: for
thou shalt receive twice as much evil for all the good thou shalt have done unto him.

verses.plain: For the most High hateth sinners, and will repay vengeance unto the ungodly, and keepeth them against the mighty day of their punishment.

tokens.t: For the most High hateth sinners, and will repay vengeance unto the ungodly, and keepeth them against the mighty day of their punishment.

verses.plain: Give unto the good, and help not the sinner.

tokens.t: Give unto the good, and help not the sinner.

verses.plain: A friend cannot be known in prosperity: and an enemy cannot be hidden in adversity.

tokens.t: A friend cannot be known in prosperity: and an enemy cannot be hidden in adversity.

verses.plain: In the prosperity of a man enemies will be grieved: but in his adversity even a friend will depart.

tokens.t: In the prosperity of a man enemies will be grieved: but in his adversity even a friend will depart.

verses.plain: Never trust thine enemy: for like as iron rusteth, so is his wickedness.

tokens.t: Never trust thine enemy: for like as iron rusteth, so is his wickedness.

verses.plain: Though he humble himself, and go crouching, yet take good heed and beware of him, and thou shalt be unto him as if thou hadst wiped a lookingglass, and thou shalt know that his rust hath not been altogether wiped away.

tokens.t: Though he humble himself, and go crouching, yet take good heed and beware of him, and thou shalt be unto him as if thou hadst wiped a lookingglass, and thou shalt know that his rust hath not been altogether wiped away.

verses.plain: Set him not by thee, lest, when he hath overthrown thee, he stand up in thy place; neither let him sit at thy right hand, lest he seek to take thy seat, and thou at the last remember my words, and be pricked therewith.

tokens.t: Set him not by thee, lest, when he hath overthrown thee, he stand up in thy place; neither let him sit at thy right hand, lest he seek to take thy seat, and thou at the last remember my words, and be pricked therewith.

verses.plain: Who will pity a charmer that is bitten with a serpent, or any such as come nigh wild beasts?

tokens.t: Who will pity a charmer that is bitten with a serpent, or any such as come nigh wild beasts?

verses.plain: So one that goeth to a sinner, and is defiled with him in his sins, who will pity?

tokens.t: So one that goeth to a sinner, and is defiled with him in his sins, who will pity?

verses.plain: For a while he will abide with thee, but if thou begin to fall, he will not tarry.

tokens.t: For a while he will abide with thee, but if thou begin to fall, he will not tarry.

verses.plain: An enemy speaketh sweetly with his lips, but in his heart he imagineth how to throw thee into a pit: he will weep with his eyes, but if he find opportunity, he will not be satisfied with blood.

tokens.t: An enemy speaketh sweetly with his lips, but in his heart he imagineth how to throw thee into a pit: he will weep with his eyes, but if he find opportunity, he will not be satisfied with blood.

verses.plain: If adversity come upon thee, thou shalt find him there first; and though he pretend to help thee, yet shall he undermine thee.

tokens.t: If adversity come upon thee, thou shalt find him there first; and though he pretend to help thee, yet shall he undermine thee.

verses.plain: He will shake his head, and clap his hands, and whisper much, and change his countenance.

tokens.t: He will shake his head, and clap his hands, and whisper much, and change his countenance.
